title: What is the need for a library in my school? - Quora

response.answer_text: An important source of knowledge for the young minds in a school is the library. It develops reading habit among the students and also has numerous other benefits. The well-equipped library of the best CBSE school in South Kolkata,Bodhibhavans is a major attraction for the students. The following are some of the benefits of a school library: · It has a positive impact on the academic achievement of students. By reading various books, they can perform better in the examination. · It helps every student to get equal access to study materials. · The technological, social and economic environment is constantly changing. The school library equips the students with the necessary skills to succeed in this changing environment. · The school library also gives students the opportunity of reading various fiction and non-fiction books other than study materials. This enriches the cultural, intellectual, aesthetic and emotional growth of the students. Every school should have a library. It gives the students a wide horizon to explore, which broadens their mind.

A library is more than a museum for books, it is a chosen place designated for reading, reflecting, and learning. There are all kinds, shapes, and sizes, of libraries only limited by the human imagination. It is a collection of information stored both in print and online. This collection is traditionally safeguarded under lock and key (or password) by a strict rule enforcing librarian! But this is only to ensure it is not so easily damaged. In reality, it is a privilege to have access to information so freely, without discrimination or social status. It is the only time some individuals feel so privileged and free. Why would anyone ever want to get rid of that? This applies to school libraries even more so because children are eager and ready to learn and be inspired. Books still inspire learning.
